00001 #ifndef MANGLE_STREAM_SLICE_H
00002 #define MANGLE_STREAM_SLICE_H
00003 
00004 #include "../stream.hpp"
00005 
00006 namespace Mangle {
00007 namespace Stream {
00008 
00011 class SliceStream : public Stream
00012 {
00013   StreamPtr src;
00014   size_t offset, length, pos;
00015 
00016  public:
00017   SliceStream(StreamPtr _src, size_t _offset, size_t _length)
00018     : src(_src), offset(_offset), length(_length), pos(0)
00019     {
00020       assert(src->hasSize);
00021       assert(src->isSeekable);
00022 
00023       // Make sure we can actually fit inside the source stream
00024       assert(src->size() >= offset+length);
00025 
00026       isSeekable = true;
00027       hasPosition = true;
00028       hasSize = true;
00029       hasPtr = src->hasPtr;
00030       isWritable = src->isWritable;
00031     }
00032 
00033   size_t read(void *buf, size_t count)
00034   {
00035     // Check that we're not reading past our slice
00036     if(count > length-pos)
00037       count = length-pos;
00038 
00039     // Seek into place and start reading
00040     src->seek(offset+pos);
00041     count = src->read(buf, count);
00042 
00043     pos += count;
00044     assert(pos <= length);
00045     return count;
00046   }
00047 
00048   // Note that writing to a slice does not allow you to append data,
00049   // you may only overwrite existing data.
00050   size_t write(const void *buf, size_t count)
00051   {
00052     assert(isWritable);
00053     // Check that we're not reading past our slice
00054     if(count > length-pos)
00055       count = length-pos;
00056 
00057     // Seek into place and action
00058     src->seek(offset+pos);
00059     count = src->write(buf, count);
00060 
00061     pos += count;
00062     assert(pos <= length);
00063     return count;
00064   }
00065 
00066   void seek(size_t _pos)
00067   {
00068     pos = _pos;
00069     if(pos > length) pos = length;
00070   }
00071 
00072   bool eof() const { return pos == length; }
00073   size_t tell() const { return pos; }
00074   size_t size() const { return length; }
00075   void flush() { src->flush(); }
00076 
00077   const void *getPtr() { return getPtr(0, length); }
00078   const void *getPtr(size_t size)
00079     {
00080       const void *ptr = getPtr(pos, size);
00081       seek(pos+size);
00082       return ptr;
00083     }
00084   const void *getPtr(size_t pos, size_t size)
00085     {
00086       // Boundry checks on pos and size. Bounding the size is
00087       // important even when getting pointers, as the source stream
00088       // may use the size parameter for something (such as memory
00089       // mapping or buffering.)
00090       if(pos > length) pos = length;
00091       if(pos+size > length) size = length-pos;
00092 
00093       // Ask the source to kindly give us a pointer
00094       return src->getPtr(offset+pos, size);
00095     }
00096 };
00097 
00098 typedef boost::shared_ptr<SliceStream> SliceStreamPtr;
00099 
00100 }} // namespaces
00101 #endif
